quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Kobe Bryant and Ski
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, hill, session. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which ski jumper was badly injured in a training session in 2002, but recovered in a month to win 2 gold medals at the Salt Lake City Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Simon Ammann

questions.question: On which hill does the World Cup ski jumping season traditionally end?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Letalnica (formerly Velikanka) in Planica, Slovenia

questions.question: Kobe Bryant changed his jersey number from 8 to 24 during the 2006-2007 NBA season.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Ski jumpers used to jump with the skis positioned parallelly. Nowadays the skis are V-shaped during the jump. Who introduced this manner of jumping in 1988?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jan Boklöv

questions.question: In 2003, Kobe Bryant was accused of rape.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This former Finnish ski jumper is one of the best in the history of the sport with his five Olympic medals (four Golds), nine World championships medals (five Golds) and 22 Finnish championships medals (13 Golds).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Matti Nykänen

questions.question: Kobe Bryant won the 1996 NBA Slam Dunk Contest.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Kobe Bryant and the Lakers won three consecutive NBA championships: 2001, 2002, and 2003.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Why  was the 2005/06 Four Hills Ski Jumping Tournament unique?

options.text: It was won ex equo by Janne Ahonen and Jakub Janda.
The winner, Sven Hannawald, won all four competitions.
The winner, Andreas Jacobsen, was the youngest ever in the history of the tournament .

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was won ex equo by Janne Ahonen and Jakub Janda.

questions.question: Which statement is true about the British ski jumper Eddie Eagle Edwards?

options.text: He was actually a woman after a sex-change operation.
He was unfit for the sport, had no financial support, but yet kept on jumping.
He was the first black man in the sport.
He has won the most medals at the Olympics.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was unfit for the sport, had no financial support, but yet kept on jumping.

questions.question: Kobe Bryant has scored 50 points or more in 4 consecutive games.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who was the first ski jumper ever to win the World Cup 3 times in a row?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adam Małysz

questions.question: Kobe Bryant scored 82 points in a single game against the Toronto Raptors.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which ski jumper broke the world record in ski jump length (239m) in 2005?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bjoern Einar Romoeren

questions.question: How many points are awarded to the winner of a ski jumping competition in the World Cup circuit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 100

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Pair and History
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, pair, singles. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In January of 2006, Rene Inoue and John Baldwin, Jr. made history at the United States National Championships. What was their historic achievement?

options.text: They successfully executed the first throw quadruple Salchow.
They invented a lift never done before.
They successfully executed the first throw triple Axel.
They became the first Japanese-Americans to win the National Championships.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They successfully executed the first throw triple Axel.

questions.question: When was the first ice dance competition held at the World Championships?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1952

questions.question: What is the nationality of Adam Małysz, one of the greatest stars of ski jumping?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Polish

questions.question: Coached by Yao Bin, this Chinese pair team have a lot of firsts under their belts. They were the first Chinese team to stand on the podium at the World Figure Skating Championships, earning silver in 1999. They later became the first Chinese team to medal at the Winter Olympics in 2002, earning the bronze, and in March of 2002 they were the first to win gold at the World Championships. Who are they?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Xue Shen  Hongbo Zhao

questions.question: Who was the first American pair to win a World Figure Skating Championship Gold Medal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Karol  Michael Kennedy

questions.question: Which hill is called the Mecca of ski jumping?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Holmenkollen in Oslo, Norway

questions.question: Who was the first Soviet Union pair to win the Winter Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Protopopovs

questions.question: This figure skater made history in 1998 when he won his second Olympic Gold Medal with a different partner, who was going for her first Olympic Gold. Name the first man to win the Olympics twice with two different partners?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Artur Dmitriev

questions.question: In what year did the legendary Jayne Torvil and Christopher Dean win their first World Championship Gold?

options.text: They never won a World Championship.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1981

questions.question: Frances Marina Anissina and Gwendal Peizerat are famous for what incredible move?

options.text: A lift in which Marina lifts Gwendal

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A lift in which Marina lifts Gwendal

questions.question: As a child, this male pairs skater skated singles. Upon losing to a younger skater from the same town, he switched to pairs. He later became a 2-time World Champion and Olympic Champion with his partner, after overcoming a near-fatal accident. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maxim Marinin

questions.question: A North American team has never won a World Championship Gold Medal in ice dance.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The first death spiral was performed by this legendary couple.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Protopopovs

questions.question: Which pair became the first to do a ratified quadruple twist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julia Obertas  Sergei Slavnov

questions.question: Which country did the first World Champions in ice dance represent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great Britain

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Bull and Calf
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, rodeo, ropes. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the primary role of a bullfighter in the rodeo event bull riding?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Protect the rider from harm

questions.question: in Game 6 of the 1986 World Series, which hitter was on deck when Mookie Wilson hit that infamous  groundball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Howard Johnson

questions.question: Which of these is considered the most common foul in timed roping rodeo events?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Breaking the barrier

questions.question: When the New York Mets traded Rick Ownbey and Neil Allen to the St. Louis Cardinals in 1983 who did they get in return?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Keith Hernandez

questions.question: What World Champion bull rider had his face crushed by a bull named Bodacious?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tuff Hedeman

questions.question: How many ropes is a calf roper allowed to use in the rodeo event calf roping?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Two

questions.question: What penalty does a barrel racer get for knocking down a barrel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5 seconds

questions.question: What is the purpose of the piece of rope used by a calf roper?

options.text: It makes the horse back up.
It is used to tie the calf.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is used to tie the calf.

questions.question: Which word refers to the bull doggers partner in the rodeo discipline known as steer wrestling?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hazer

questions.question: Gil Hodges hit the first Mets home run.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What New York Mets slugger won Rookie of the Year in 1983?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Darryl Strawberry

questions.question: Who was the New York Mets player who hit 3 home runs in one game in the 1999 National League Division Series held at Shea Stadium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It never happened.

questions.question: What bull was commonly referred to as “The World’s Most Dangerous Bull”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bodacious

questions.question: How must the calf be caught in the event known as calf roping?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: With rope only

questions.question: In the rodeo event called calf roping, riders have a rope woven within their belts. What is it called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerk line

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Gold and Medals
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, field, athlete. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Some of the swimming events at the 2012 Olympic Games were held in this venue, which also hosts a race every Christmas morning for the Peter Pan Cup.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Serpentine

questions.question: In what 2012 Summer Olympics athletics competition did the gold, silver and bronze medals go to Jamaica?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mens 200 metres

questions.question: Which country won the most medals at the 2012 Summer Olympic Games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: USA

questions.question: What was the first logo of the New England Patriots?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a hat

questions.question: Which mens national team is NOT correctly matched with the sport in which they won a gold medal in the 2012 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brazil - indoor volleyball

questions.question: Who did New England Patriots play against in their second Super Bowl appearance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Packers

questions.question: What year did the New England Patriots go to their first Super Bowl?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1986

questions.question: Which of these gymnastics disciplines, contested at the 2012 Olympic Games, was the last to be recognised as an Olympic discipline?

options.text: They all became Olympic disciplines in the same year.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: trampolining

questions.question: What year did the New England Patriots become a franchise?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1960

questions.question: What member of the British royal family won a silver medal in the 2012 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zara Phillips

questions.question: What track and field athlete became double Olympic champion at the 2012 Olympic Games in London, taking gold in both the 5000 and 10,000 metres?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mo Farah

questions.question: In the 2012 Summer Olympics, this athlete won four gold and two silver medals, making him the most decorated Olympic athlete for the third Olympics in a row.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Phelps

questions.question: Which of these disciplines was included for the first time in the Olympic program at the 2012 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: womens boxing

questions.question: Which of the following female swimmers did not set a world record at the 2012 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth Beisel

questions.question: In which of these years did the New York Mets qualify for the postseason as the National League Wild Card team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1999 and 2000

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Kobe Bryant and Year
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, patriots, dads. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was the first Super Bowl MVP for the New England Patriots?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Brady

questions.question: In what NBA season was Kobe Bryant awarded the regular seasons MVP Award?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2007-08

questions.question: Who did Kobe Bryant take to his senior prom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brandy Norwood

questions.question: How many consecutive NBA championships did Kobe Bryant win with the Lakers in the early 2000s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3

questions.question: In 2005, Kobe Bryant scored 81 points against the Toronto Raptors.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Kobe Bryant said on TNT that he wanted this jersey number as a rookie in the 2006-2007 season.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 24

questions.question: Who was the New England Patriots first round pick in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Laurence Maroney

questions.question: What year did the New England Patriots win their first Super Bowl?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2001

questions.question: In what year did Kobe Bryant first become a member of the USA Mens Senior Olympics Team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2008

questions.question: What New England Patriots player was named AP Defensive Rookie of the Year for 2008?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerod Mayo

questions.question: What was Kobe Bryants dads nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jellybean

questions.question: Who was the New England Patriots first round pick in 2008?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerod Mayo

questions.question: Who was the the New England Patriots first round draft pick in 2007?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brandon Meriweather

questions.question: In 2003, Kobe Bryant tied the NBA record for most three pointers in a game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What team did Kobe Bryant get drafted by in 1996?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hornets

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Jeff Hardy and Song
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, hardy, opening. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What name was given to the London 2012 Olympic Games Opening Ceremony that took place on 27 July 2012?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isles of Wonder

questions.question: Why did Jeff Hardy got suspended for 60 days in May 2008?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: For illegal drug use

questions.question: Paul McCartney closed the opening ceremony of the 2012 Summer Olympics singing this song and inviting the audience to join in on the coda.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hey Jude

questions.question: What song was used at the climax of the 2012 Summer Olympics opening ceremony, immediately following the lighting of the cauldron?

options.text: Another Brick in the Wall by Pink Floyd
Rolling in the Deep by Adele

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eclipse by Pink Floyd

questions.question: What is the slogan of the 2012 Summer Olympic Games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Inspire a Generation

questions.question: What team led the Parade of Nations at the 2012 Summer Olympic Games Opening Ceremony?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the team of Greece

questions.question: In what year was Jeff Hardy released from WWE because of his erratic behavior, drug use, and refusal to go to rehab?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2003

questions.question: Jeff Hardy and Matt Hardy are not actually brothers. They just play brothers on TV.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who played James Bond in the BBC short film, Happy and Glorious, which stars Queen Elizabeth II as herself?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daniel Craig

questions.question: From 1965 to 2008, all of the Mr. Olympia titles were won by US citizens.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: On July 27 2012, Queen Elizabeth II opened the Olympic Games for the second time in her reign. When was the first time she opened the Olympic Games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Montreal, Canada 1976

questions.question: At the 2012 Summer Olympic Games Opening Ceremony, this celebrity was seen driving a motor boat down the River Thames and under Tower Bridge to the music I Heard Wonders by David Holmes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Beckham

questions.question: A segment of the London 2012 Opening Ceremony paid tribute to the victims of this terrorist attack.

options.text: the 18 July 2012 terrorist attack on Israeli tourists in Bourgas, Bulgaria

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the 2005 London Bombings

questions.question: Danny Boyle, the artistic director of 2012 Summer Olympics Opening Ceremony, won an Academy Award for which of the following movies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Slumdog Millionaire

questions.question: Which of these is Kobe Bryants nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black Mamba
